channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: An AI Salvador Dalí will answer any question when called on his famous 'lobster phone'
item.description: Ask Dalí, a new AI installation based on a copy of Dalí's iconic sculpture, allows visitors to pick up the crustacean-shaped receiver, ask a question, and hear Dalí's response.
item.content:encoded: Ask Dalí, a new AI installation based on a copy of Dalí's iconic sculpture, allows visitors to pick up the crustacean-shaped receiver, ask a question, and hear Dalí's response.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Trump cancels rally due to weather, as he tries to balance his trial and campaign
item.description: Donald Trump had to cancel his first planned rally since the start of his criminal hush money trial because of a storm Saturday evening in North Carolina.
item.content:encoded:
Donald Trump had to cancel his first planned rally since the start of his criminal hush money trial because of a storm Saturday evening in North Carolina.

(Image credit: Chris Seward)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 15 people injured in tram crash at Universal Studios Hollywood
item.description: A tram accident at Universal Studios Hollywood in Los Angeles injured 15 people Saturday night, authorities and the company said.
item.content:encoded:
A tram accident at Universal Studios Hollywood in Los Angeles injured 15 people Saturday night, authorities and the company said.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Gaza hostages raise painful reminders as Jews prepare for Passover
item.description: Among the themes of Passover is freedom from captivity. For many Jews this year, the holiday brings up the pain of knowledge that hostages are still captive after the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel.
item.content:encoded: Among the themes of Passover is freedom from captivity. For many Jews this year, the holiday brings up the pain of knowledge that hostages are still captive after the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel.
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: Israeli strikes on southern Gaza city of Rafah kill 18, including 14 children
item.description: Israeli strikes on the southern Gaza city of Rafah killed 18 people, including 14 children. Meanwhile, the United States approved $26bn in aid for Israel, including around $9bn for Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli strikes on the southern Gaza city of Rafah killed 18 people, including 14 children. Meanwhile, the United States approved $26bn in aid for Israel, including around $9bn for Gaza.

(Image credit: Ismael Abu Dayyah)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: At least 2 killed, many injured in shooting at Memphis block party, police say
item.description: Eight people were shot including two men who were killed at an unsanctioned public party in a Memphis city park Saturday night, police said.
item.content:encoded: Eight people were shot including two men who were killed at an unsanctioned public party in a Memphis city park Saturday night, police said.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 2 Japanese navy helicopters crash in the Pacific Ocean — 1 dead and 7 missing
item.description: Two Japanese navy helicopters carrying eight crew members crashed in the Pacific Ocean during a nighttime training flight after possibly colliding with each other.
item.content:encoded: Two Japanese navy helicopters carrying eight crew members crashed in the Pacific Ocean during a nighttime training flight after possibly colliding with each other.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Siblings, 8 and 5, killed as suspected drunk driver crashes into children's birthday
item.description: A young brother and sister died and several people were injured, some seriously, when a vehicle driven by a suspected drunken driver crashed into a young child's birthday party at a boat club.
item.content:encoded:
A young brother and sister died and several people were injured, some seriously, when a vehicle driven by a suspected drunken driver crashed into a young child's birthday party at a boat club.

(Image credit: Kathleen Kildee)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A video shows people trying to pull 2 black bear cubs from trees in North Carolina
item.description: A video shows apartment complex residents in North Carolina trying to pull two wild black bear cubs from a tree to pose with them. One person manages to grab a cub before it runs away.
item.content:encoded: A video shows apartment complex residents in North Carolina trying to pull two wild black bear cubs from a tree to pose with them. One person manages to grab a cub before it runs away.
item.dc:creator: Clare Marie Schneider

item.title: Military court convicts U.S. sailor of attempted espionage
item.description: A naval chief petty officer who served on a Japan-based destroyer was found guilty of sharing classified information with a foreign government, the Navy's investigative agency said.
item.content:encoded:
A naval chief petty officer who served on a Japan-based destroyer was found guilty of sharing classified information with a foreign government, the Navy's investigative agency said.

(Image credit: Christopher Bosch)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett
